Texts.Chs: 想象一下，在一颗半影行星上有一座水上城市，每个季节都会被烧成灰烬？当然，如果是这样的话，夜族人就有理由逃到地下，再也不回来了。
Texts.Eng: Imagine having a surface city on a Penumbra planet that would be scorched to cinders every season? Yet if this were the case it would give reason to flee underground and never return.

Texts.Chs: 夜族人是在哪里对未知和光产生如此强烈的恐惧的？虽然他们对阳光有直接的反应(阳光对他们的几个分支是致命的，但在大多数情况下仅仅是有毒的，并引起类似于过敏反应的反应) ,
Texts.Eng: Where did the Nightar develop such overwhelming fear of the unknown, and light? While it is true that there is precedent due to their rather unfortunate reaction to direct sunlight (its lethal to several branches of their lineage, though merely toxic and causes reactions similar to anaphylaxis in most),

Texts.Chs: 但这也不太可能造成我们所看到的严重的文化恐慌。相反，我认为某种形式的大气效应，也许是它们的母星所独有的，是造成这种现象的原因。也许在他们的行星历史上，形成了臭氧空洞。
Texts.Eng: it is unlikely that this would cause a gross cultural terror of the level we see. Instead, I posit that some form of atmospheric effect, perhaps unique to their homeworld, is responsible. Perhaps during their planets history, a hole in the ozone formed. If this were the case, and the planetary rotation led

Texts.Chs: 如果是这样的话，行星的自转使这个洞跨过天空，照耀着下面的世界，那将是一个集中的光束，可以按季节将整个区域烧焦。这对文化和发展产生的影响是毋庸置疑的，因为它也会使行星表面几乎不适合居住。
Texts.Eng: to this hole moving across the heavens to shine upon the world below, there would be a concentrated beam of light that could quite literally scorch entire regions on a seasonal basis. The effect this would have on culture and development is beyond doubt, as it would also render the surface nearly unlivable.
